examples: Back in California, the contraband was handed off to Wen and Tan, who arranged to have the phones shipped to their contacts in Asia.
Robert Polk … comes in carrying a gorgeous brisket fresh from the smoker and hands it off to Smitty, who starts slicing it to make sandwiches and plates.

definition: to pass or delegate (a task or responsibility) to another
examples: I know how it feels … to wish I could hand off this never-ending responsibility and just go to the movies, any movie, without a diaper and a bottle in my bag.
Inundated by more information than we can possibly hold in our heads, we're increasingly handing off the job of remembering to search engines and smart phones.

definition: to hand the ball to a nearby teammate on a play
examples: The draw is a simple football play, a running play in which the quarterback delays before handing off the ball.
New York center Mel Hein snapped the ball to quarterback Harry Newman, who handed off to halfback Ken Strong, who tried to sweep around left end.
